title: Null pointer dereference in SMTP server function smtp_command_parse_data_with_size

profile.name: Open-Xchange
profile.about: Messaging, collaboration and office productivity software for service providers

vulnerability_information:
Sending the following bytes to the SMTP server induces a NULL pointer dereference

```
0x20,0x0,0x0,0x1,0xa,0x20,0x0,0xa,0x20,0x39,0x20,0xa,0x8,0x3b,0xa,0x0,0x1,0xa,0x0,0x20,0xa,0x8,0x3b,0xa,0x42,0x46,0x41,0x54,0xa,0x44,0x41,0x54,0x20,0x51,0xa,0xa,0x42,0x44,0x41,0x54,0x20,0x35,0x20,0x42,0x44,0x41,0xa,0xff,0xa,0x20,0xfd,0xc1,0x42,0x20,0xfd,0x20,0xa,0xa,0x20,0x20,0xfd,0xa7,0x41,0x54,0x41,0x49,0x54,0x20,0x20,0xa,0x20,0xde,0x9e,0x9e,0x20,0x20,0xa,0xa,0x20,0xde,0xa,0xee,0xa,0x41,0x54,0x20,0x30,0x20,0xa,0x20,0x41,0x67,0xa,0x4d,0x41,0x49,0x4c,0x8a,0x20,0xa,0x42,0x44,0x41,0x54,0xa,0x42,0x44,0x41,0x54,0x20,0xa,0x52,0x53,0x45,0x54,0xa,0x20,0xbb,0x9c,0x2a,0x9,0x9,0x9,0x9,0x9,0x9,0x9,0x9,0xa,0x9,0x9,0x9,0x9,0x9,0x9,0x9,0xff,0x2d,0x54,0x54,0x2a,0xa,
```

Stack trace is

```
    #0 0x10083ef30 in smtp_command_parse_data_with_size smtp-command-parser.c:498
    #1 0x100849b2e in smtp_server_cmd_bdat smtp-server-cmd-data.c:660
    #2 0x100854a46 in smtp_server_command_new smtp-server-command.c:248
    #3 0x10086a139 in smtp_server_connection_handle_command smtp-server-connection.c:299
    #4 0x1008693e3 in smtp_server_connection_handle_input smtp-server-connection.c:434
    #5 0x100868d4a in smtp_server_connection_input smtp-server-connection.c:583
    #6 0x1008f278b in io_loop_call_io ioloop.c:713
    #7 0x1008f3970 in io_loop_call_pending ioloop.c:751
    #8 0x1008f3449 in io_loop_handler_run ioloop.c:766
    #9 0x1008f30cd in io_loop_run ioloop.c:738
    #10 0x1007ebdc1 in LLVMFuzzerTestOneInput fuzz-smtp-server.c:86
```

Indeed `smtp_server_cmd_bdat` calls `smtp_command_parse_data_with_size` with first parameter being `conn->smtp_parser` which got assigned to NULL by the previous call to `smtp_server_reply` calling `smtp_server_command_submit_reply`, calling `smtp_server_connection_terminate` if `conn->bad_counter > conn->set.max_bad_commands`

One quick fix is 
```
diff --git a/src/lib-smtp/smtp-server-cmd-data.c b/src/lib-smtp/smtp-server-cmd-data.c
index 7d81d927f0..117a8b9b4e 100644
--- a/src/lib-smtp/smtp-server-cmd-data.c
+++ b/src/lib-smtp/smtp-server-cmd-data.c
@@ -654,7 +654,7 @@ void smtp_server_cmd_bdat(struct smtp_server_cmd_ctx *cmd,
                }
        }
 
-       if (ret > 0 || size > 0) {
+       if (ret > 0 || (size > 0 && conn->smtp_parser != NULL)) {
                /* read/skip data even in case of error, as long as size is
                   known */
                input = smtp_command_parse_data_with_size(conn->smtp_parser,
```

## Impact

A null pointer dereference induces a crash of the SMTP server

activities.message: Thank you for the report, we'll look into it.
activities.markdown_message: Thank you for the report, we'll look into it.

activities.message:
Hi!

I am not able to reproduce this with valgrind, or get the crash. Am I missing something?
activities.markdown_message:
Hi!

I am not able to reproduce this with valgrind, or get the crash. Am I missing something?

activities.message: Do you know what is your value for `conn->set.max_bad_commands` ? Mine is 10
activities.markdown_message: Do you know what is your value for conn->set.max_bad_commands ? Mine is 10

activities.message: Ah, no. It seems to require login first, and after that you can only crash your own connection. So this is actually not a CVE at all, but a regular bug.
activities.markdown_message: Ah, no. It seems to require login first, and after that you can only crash your own connection. So this is actually not a CVE at all, but a regular bug.

activities.message: Ok, should I make a GitHub PR for this fix then ?
activities.markdown_message: Ok, should I make a GitHub PR for this fix then ?

activities.message: You can make github pr, yes.
This bug is still present and got found by oss-fuzz https://bugs.chromium.org/p/oss-fuzz/issues/detail?id=23508
